website_summaries.verdict: Announces the time on demand and can be set to military time. Be aware, though, that there are no actual Braille markings, so fully blind customers will be dependent upon the auditory announcements.
pros: Digital watch announces the time in a clear voice speaking English with an American accent
Automatic time announcement on the hour can be turned on or off
Can be set to 12-hour or 24-hour time
cons: Volume level for voice is not adjustable

customer_reviews.title: better than the older models in every way possible
customer_reviews.text: My blind grandmother has used an older model of this watch for a while now, but they've all worn out over the years. This new model is way better in almost every way imaginable. The buttons are easier to press, the band is very soft and flexible whereas the old one was fairly stiff and hard. I am very impressed because basically every complaint she had about the old one has been taken care of completely with this newer model. And it is still just as loud, which is what really sets this watch apart from every other talking watch I've ever seen.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Funkystuff

customer_reviews.title: easy to use functions
customer_reviews.text: Loud clear voice, easy to use functions. The bottom left button only makes loud beeps, so it wouldn't be obvious to a blind person what it is. Also, just by the vocals on the watch, it would be difficult to learn to set the watch. Once set and explained it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery is Not Replaceable
customer_reviews.text: The battery is soldered into the unit. I bought this for my blind father and the battery went dead within a month. Took it to the jewelry store and the battery is not removable. Pretty much useless now. Not cool!
customer_reviews.author: Cranky Cowgirl

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this watch for Christmas for our blind uncle & This watch stop working after a little over a month! Wouldn’t recommend!
customer_reviews.author: B J Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended: Stopped Working after 8 Months
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this watch for a blind person on October 28, 2018. It was very easy to use. However, it stopped working this week. We tested the battery and it's good but the watch is not working, no display, no sound. We don't know what kind of warranty they offer. It is inexpensive but still it is a waste money and an inconvenience for a blind person.
customer_reviews.author: SuSu

customer_reviews.title: non clear voice
customer_reviews.text: I liked the look of the watch but the voice stating the time is horrible, not very loud at all and there has to be deep silence when hearing the time. But this is to be expeced as the cheap watch price wise was a cheap watch,
customer_reviews.author: el tigre

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for a gift for a woman that I know that is blind the instructions we're a little difficult to understand wish it was a more clear

customer_reviews.title: Simple, yet exactly what we wanted
customer_reviews.text: Husband is visually impaired, had this same watch, and didn't know how much he relied on it until he lost it! Simple, easy to change the battery when needed.

customer_reviews.title: Good price and quality
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th one and they usually last a year or two. I have them announce the time on the hour

customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed, can't see regular watch, arrived on time in good condition

customer_reviews.title: Beware - this item is not returnable.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a 98-year-old friend who is blind, and she had trouble with small buttons, so went to return it and found this watch (sold through the JM Trading Co.) is not returnable. Did not see anything about this when I purchased the item.

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Purchased one talking watch, which had a very garbled voice, plus insufficient/vague instructions difficult for a sighted person to read. Could not control the alarm feature. Two were sent. I was charged for two, even though my amazon account only shows purchase of one watch. Wanted to return - but only exchange or store credit allowed. Buyer beware.

customer_reviews.title: My son has been blind for 19 years and this ...
customer_reviews.text: My son has been blind for 19 years and this watch helps him to know when to take his medicine he is 51 years old and brittle diebete

customer_reviews.title: Missing menu button. I asked for a replacement watch, but didn’t hear back.
customer_reviews.text: It arrived without a button on the main menu button.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed

customer_reviews.title: Watches never work!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased at least three, hoping one will work but unfortunately they all had one problem or another. The vendor tried to rectify the situation but even the replacement watch never even turned on.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for someone that needs help seeing the time!
customer_reviews.text: Talking watches have been around for a while now, at least since the early 1980's. The voice, style and manufacturing still seem the same but it's exactly what I expected and wanted. I'm giving this one as a gift. My father refuses to put on his glasses, so hearing the time is a great solution.
customer_reviews.author: Jolene Sugarbaker

customer_reviews.title: Like my old Seiko talker better
customer_reviews.text: It talks, but inserts "The time is now..." I know that, just say the time. Like my old Seiko talker better.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: It would've been nice to receive a new watch with a working battery
customer_reviews.text: Dead battery, thought it was broke. It would've been nice to receive a new watch with a working battery.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a friend who is experiencing diminished vision. He loved it and found it easy to use.

customer_reviews.title: Great watch for the $$$
customer_reviews.text: Its a good product for the price..seems very durable % its water resistant..

customer_reviews.title: Not very loud
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my Dad who is hard of hearing and he can’t hear it. Does not come with a volume controller.

customer_reviews.text: Great product. Works well. Bought it for a friend who’s visually impaired. He loved it.

customer_reviews.title: This is a cheap knockoff of the Tel-Time talking watch -- don't buy it
customer_reviews.text: Spend the little extra money and buy the Tel-Time talking watch.

customer_reviews.title: does not work. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: from the time I got it, this did not work at all. We got it for our father who cannot hear and thought it would be wonderful, and it is a piece of junk. I am trying to return it and it doesn't look good and I am quite upset. Do not But this, believe me you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: L. Muir

product_meta.title: Classic Talking Watch
product_meta.description: Here's a must for any blind person! Whenever you tap the button on the side of this talking watch; a clear female voice will read the time to you. By pressing one more button; you can turn the Hourly Time Announce feature on or off. And at the touch of a few more buttons; you can set a beeping alarm to wake you. Perhaps best of all; every feature of this watch is totally accessible by a blind person. It's a piece of cake to tell whether the alarm is set to go off - and when; and to check if Hourly Report is toggled on or off. You can also set it to speak the time in either 12-hour or 24-hour military style. And of course; the watch has a large LCD display; and a fully adjustable plastic strap - meaning it can fit kids and adults alike. So; whether you're buying this attractive; nicely-boxed talking watch as a special treat for yourself or a friend; it's sure to be a practical tool that'll be used all the time! (Uses one CR2016 battery; included.)
feature_bullets: Digital Talking Watch Announces the Time in a clear male voice (English speaking in an American accent)
Automatic Hourly Time Announcement that may be turned ON or OFF
Alarm Feature gives you the option to set an Audible Reminder
Digital Time display can be set to 12-hour or 24-hour military time
Battery Type: Uses (1) CR2016 - Estimated life per battery is approximately 3 Years contingent on Frequency of using the Talking Feature
